Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security

official_title: To establish a grant program for States and Indian Tribes to enroll individuals purchasing firearms and holders of licenses or permits to possess, carry, sell, or transfer firearms into the FBI's Rap Back program.
short_title: Law Enforcement Needs to Know Act

summary.text:
Law Enforcement Needs to Know Act

This bill directs the Department of Justice to award grants to state and tribal governments to enroll individuals who purchase firearms or apply for firearm licenses in the Federal Bureau of Investigation's Rap Back Service. The service provides notice to authorized law enforcement agencies of arrests or other activity of firearm licensees that might impact their continued eligibility for a license.

titles.title: To establish a grant program for States and Indian Tribes to enroll individuals purchasing firearms and holders of licenses or permits to possess, carry, sell, or transfer firearms into the FBI's Rap Back program.
